newsitem.title: UK: GDR REPORT-India rally runs out of steam.
newsitem.headline: GDR REPORT-India rally runs out of steam.

text.p: The expansion of premiums investors are prepared to pay for global depositary receipts (GDRs) over the local stock ran out of steam on Thursday as a rally in Bombay sputtered in slim volume.
"There was nowhere to go with Bombay seeing such thin volumes," said a trader.
The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR index JCEAI closed up 0.59 points, 0.82 percent, at 72.84 points, with the premium over the local market at 12.09 percent compared with yesterday's 10.86 percent.
The Bombay Stock Exchange 30-share index fell 17.42 points, or 0.51 percent, to 3,388.80.

"The rally over the past few days in Indian GDRs has not been based on any real client demand, we have seen some small orders, but not very much. People are tending to rotate the stocks day-by-day. It is not a trend," a trader said.
The Capel Korea GDR Index ended down 0.57 points, 0.79 percent, at 71.02, a premium of 18.37 percent over the local market, compared with yesterday's 17.65 percent.
The Korea Composite Index fell 9.49 points to a provisional 779.63.
The Capel Taiwan GDR Index ended down 0.85 points, 0.95 percent, at 88.30, a premium of 6.98 percent after 7.12 percent yesterday.
The Taiwan Weighted Index fell 16.96 points or 0.27 percent to close at 6,160.82.
